Our world in data worldwide cases and tests

Source: R/owid_data.R
owid_data.Rd

The OurWoldInData dataset includes country-level testing, deaths, and confirmed cases for most countries in the world.

owid_data()

Source

  • https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus

References

Max Roser, Hannah Ritchie, Esteban Ortiz-Ospina and Joe Hasell (2020) - "Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19)". Published online at OurWorldInData.org. Retrieved from: 'https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus' Online Resource

See also

Other case-tracking: align_to_baseline(), beoutbreakprepared_data(), bulk_estimate_Rt(), combined_us_cases_data(), covidtracker_data(), ecdc_data(), estimate_Rt(), eu_data_cache_data(), jhu_data(), nytimes_county_data(), plot_epicurve(), usa_facts_data()

Examples

res = owid_data()
#> Warning: download failed
#>   web resource path: ‘https://covid.ourworldindata.org/data/owid-covid-data.csv’
#>   local file path: ‘/Users/sdavis2/Library/Caches/sars2pack/file8f0a60b100be’
#>   reason: HTTP/2 stream 0 was closed cleanly, but before getting  all response header fields, treated as error
#> Warning: bfcdownload() failed
#>   rid: BFC50
#>   file: ‘https://covid.ourworldindata.org/data/owid-covid-data.csv’
#>   reason: download failed
#> Error: download failed; see warnings()
colnames(res)
#> Error in is.data.frame(x): object 'res' not found

head(res)
#> Error in head(res): object 'res' not found

dplyr::glimpse(res)
#> Error in dplyr::glimpse(res): object 'res' not found
